faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-EU citizens may require additional documentation and fiscal identification (NIE), but the process is straightforward and well-established. Spanish conveyancers handle all legal requirements, and many English-speaking legal services specialize in foreign acquisitions on the Costa Blanca.

faqs.question: What are the typical rental yields on Costa Blanca properties?
faqs.answer: Holiday rental yields on the Costa Blanca typically range 8-18% depending on location, property type, and management efficiency. This Benijófar apartment, with typical weekly rates of €800, generates approximately 15.8% gross yield at 65% occupancy, translating to €41,600 annually before management expenses and utilities.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca demonstrates strong investment fundamentals with +8% year-on-year appreciation, established holiday rental markets, and mature expat infrastructure supporting operational management. faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs in Spain typically include 6-8% transfer tax, 1% notary fees, 0.5% registration fees, and legal conveyancer charges (approximately 1-1.5%). Total acquisition costs generally represent 10-12% of purchase price. Additional costs include possible mortgage arrangement fees if financing, and annual property tax (approximately 0.4-1.1% of cadastral value depending on region).

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes, Spanish mortgage lenders increasingly accommodate non-resident foreign buyers. Typical terms include 70% LTV, competitive rates indexed to Euribor, and 20-30 year terms. Most lenders require NIE (fiscal identification), proof of income, and standard due diligence. English-speaking mortgage brokers specialize in foreign buyer financing, particularly on the Costa Blanca.

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers competitive cost of living compared to northern Europe. Groceries, restaurants, and utilities are 20-40% less expensive than UK equivalents. Healthcare is subsidized for property investors registering as residents. Benijófar specifically provides lower living costs than beachfront towns while maintaining full infrastructure access, making it particularly cost-efficient for property owners.

faqs.question: Hur långt är det från Sverige till Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport (35 kilometers from Benijófar) operates direct flights to UK airports with flight times of approximately 2.5 hours. Multiple airlines provide daily connections to London, Manchester, and regional UK airports, supporting efficient management of Spanish property investments from the UK.

faqs.question: Hur är vädret på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca offers Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of sunshine annually, mild winters (10-15°C), and warm summers (28-32°C). Rainfall concentrates in autumn/spring, with dry summers ideal for holiday tourism. Climate consistency supports year-round holiday rental operations and makes the region attractive to visitors escaping northern European winters.

faqs.question: How do I manage a holiday rental property remotely from the UK?
faqs.answer: Professional property management companies throughout the Costa Blanca handle lettings, cleaning, maintenance, and guest communication for typically 25-35% of rental income. Online booking platforms (Airbnb, Booking.com, VRBO) automate reservations, while accounting services manage tax compliance. English-speaking managers with established tenant networks reduce operational complexity for remote UK-based owners.
